properties.value: The Battle of Plain of Mud was a major battle in mid Fourth Age, held between the eleven Goblin tribes: Thorobshuun, Garagorshuun, Rekeshuun, Drogokishuun, Huzamogaarb, Saragorgak, Ekeleshuun, Idithuun, Narogoshuun, Horogothgar, Yurkolgokh (minus the Dorgeshuun, who had established a hidden city deep underground centuries before.)[1][2] The battle was a turning point in goblin history, now remembered by goblins far and wide as the turn of the new Goblin century.

content:
The RuneScape Wiki also has an article on: rsw:Battle of Plain of Mud
Battle of Plain of Mud
Date Mid Fourth Age
Place Hemenster, near the Goblin cave
Outcome Goblins stop battling other tribes
Combatants
Thorobshuun, Garagorshuun, Rekeshuun, Drogokishuun, Huzamogaarb, Saragorgak, Ekeleshuun, Idithuun, Narogoshuun, Horogothgar, Yurkolgokh
Commanders
Respective leaders of the tribes
Strength
Huge amount of goblins all over the Gielinor
Casualties
Many goblins

The Battle of Plain of Mud was a major battle in mid Fourth Age, held between the eleven Goblin tribes: Thorobshuun, Garagorshuun, Rekeshuun, Drogokishuun, Huzamogaarb, Saragorgak, Ekeleshuun, Idithuun, Narogoshuun, Horogothgar, Yurkolgokh (minus the Dorgeshuun, who had established a hidden city deep underground centuries before.)[1][2] The battle was a turning point in goblin history, now remembered by goblins far and wide as the turn of the new Goblin century.

Tensions started among the goblins after the God Wars when their god Bandos was banished from Gielinor, leaving the eleven goblin tribes on their own. Without Bandos and other gods, goblins didn't have enough to eat.[3] They first tried to fight humans, but they were not interested in fighting and built walls to defend themselves against attacks.[4] This led goblins to attack each other over food. The conflicts culminated in one large battle between the eleven tribes.[5] The battle lasted for many days, causing a large number of casualties.[6]

Then Hopespear of the Narogoshuun tribe had a vision by Bandos,[7] who told him that goblins are very mighty fighters, but they must stop the battle, otherwise no goblin will be left to live.[8] Bandos told that goblins must find someone to battle, but it must not be other goblins.[9] He also told Hopespear that he would soon send the goblins a commander, who would lead them to glory.[10]

After Hopespear told about his vision to his general, all of the remaining goblin generals agreed to end the battle.[11] Hopespear's vision was written down in a Goblin Book, and a temple was built in the place where Battle of Plain of Mud took place.[12]

Trivia[edit | edit source]

  • Land of the Goblins confirms the location of the final battle and the Goblin Temple to be the Goblin cave near Hemenster.

References[edit | edit source]

  1. ^ Goblin scribe, Old School RuneScape. "But General Bloodfist of the Dorgeshuun refused to fight in this battle. Instead he commanded the Dorgeshuun army to march down into a fissure in the ground. General Bloodfist stood at the mouth of the fissure and defied the might of the evil god."
  2. ^ Zanik, "The Lost Tribe", Old School RuneScape. "We've been cut off from other goblins for generations"
  3. ^ Goblin book, page 8, Old School RuneScape. "Then all gods leave world, leave their armies behind. ... But now goblins not have enough to eat, and have no commanders to tell them who to fight."
  4. ^ Goblin book, page 8, Old School RuneScape. "But tall people build cities with walls, they not want to fight."
  5. ^ Goblin book, page 8-9, Old School RuneScape. "But now goblins not have enough to eat, and have no commanders to tell them who to fight. So goblin tribes fight one another. At last all goblin tribes have big battle on plain of mud."
  6. ^ Goblin book, page 9, Old School RuneScape. "Battle last many days and many goblins die, battle is glorious! But goblin corpses cover the ground and it look like all die."
  7. ^ Goblin book, page 9-10, Old School RuneScape. "Then Hopespear of the Narogoshunn tribe have vision of Big High War God."
  8. ^ Goblin book, page 10, Old School RuneScape. "This is the word of Big High War God: Battle is indeed glorious and goblins are soldiers but if there too much battle all goblins die! No more must goblin fight against goblin or tribe against tribe"
  9. ^ Goblin book, page 10-11, Old School RuneScape. "Goblins must find other enemies to fight, but not fight each other!"
  10. ^ Goblin book, page 11, Old School RuneScape. "but someday I will send a new Commander to lead you. Under new Commander goblins will conquer all of Gielinor, every race and every god!"
  11. ^ Goblin book, page 12, Old School RuneScape. "So leaders of tribes stop battle."
  12. ^ Goblin book, page 12, Old School RuneScape. "And on plain of mud all tribes build temple to Big High War God and offer sacrifices."

The '''Battle of Plain of Mud''' was a major battle in mid [[Fourth Age]], held between the eleven Goblin tribes: [[Thorobshuun]], [[Garagorshuun]], [[Rekeshuun]], [[Drogokishuun]], [[Huzamogaarb]], [[Saragorgak]], [[Ekeleshuun]], [[Idithuun]], [[Narogoshuun]], [[Horogothgar]], [[Yurkolgokh]] (minus the [[Dorgeshuun]], who had established a hidden city deep underground centuries before.){{CiteNPC|npc=Goblin scribe|quote=But General Bloodfist of the Dorgeshuun refused to fight in this battle. Instead he commanded the Dorgeshuun army to march down into a fissure in the ground. General Bloodfist stood at the mouth of the fissure and defied the might of the evil god.}}{{CiteNPC|npc=Zanik|loc=The Lost Tribe|quote=We've been cut off from other goblins for generations}} The battle was a turning point in goblin history, now remembered by goblins far and wide as the turn of the new Goblin century. 

Tensions started among the [[goblin]]s after the [[God Wars]] when their god [[Bandos]] was banished from [[Gielinor]], leaving the eleven goblin tribes on their own.
Without Bandos and other [[gods]], goblins didn't have enough to eat.{{CiteText|text=Goblin book|page=8|quote=Then all gods leave world, leave their armies behind. ... But now goblins not have enough to eat, and have no commanders to tell them who to fight.}} They first tried to fight humans, but they were not interested in fighting and built walls to defend themselves against attacks.{{CiteText|text=Goblin book|page=8|quote=But tall people build cities with walls, they not want to fight.}} This led goblins to attack each other over food.
The conflicts culminated in one large battle between the eleven tribes.{{CiteText|text=Goblin book|page=8-9|quote=But now goblins not have enough to eat, and have no commanders to tell them who to fight. So goblin tribes fight one another. At last all goblin tribes have big battle on plain of mud.}} The battle lasted for many days, causing a large number of casualties.{{CiteText|text=Goblin book|page=9|quote=Battle last many days and many goblins die, battle is glorious! But goblin corpses cover the ground and it look like all die.}} 

Then [[Hopespear]] of the Narogoshuun tribe had a vision by Bandos,{{CiteText|text=Goblin book|page=9-10|quote=Then Hopespear of the Narogoshunn tribe have vision of Big High War God.}} who told him that goblins are very mighty fighters, but they must stop the battle, otherwise no goblin will be left to live.{{CiteText|text=Goblin book|page=10|quote=This is the word of Big High War God: Battle is indeed glorious and goblins are soldiers but if there too much battle all goblins die! No more must goblin fight against goblin or tribe against tribe}} Bandos told that goblins must find someone to battle, but it must not be other goblins.{{CiteText|text=Goblin book|page=10-11|quote=Goblins must find other enemies to fight, but not fight each other!}} He also told Hopespear that he would soon send the goblins a commander, who would lead them to glory.{{CiteText|text=Goblin book|page=11|quote=but someday I will send a new Commander to lead you. Under new Commander goblins will conquer all of Gielinor, every race and every god!}}

After Hopespear told about his vision to his general, all of the remaining goblin generals agreed to end the battle.{{CiteText|text=Goblin book|page=12|quote=So leaders of tribes stop battle.}} Hopespear's vision was written down in a [[Goblin Book]], and a [[Goblin Cave|temple]] was built in the place where Battle of Plain of Mud took place.{{CiteText|text=Goblin book|page=12|quote=And on plain of mud all tribes build temple to Big High War God and offer sacrifices.}}

* [[Land of the Goblins]] confirms the location of the final battle and the [[Goblin Temple]] to be the [[Goblin cave]] near [[Hemenster]].
